titleStmt.title: Theodore M. Morgan to James W. Tate
CWG7755

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
Office of MORGAN, HANSON & CO.
N. E. corner Dock and Walnut Streets,
(Opposite Merchants' Exchange.)
Philadelphia, September 19th 1862
Jas. W Tate Esq.
Assis't Secretary of State
Louisville, Kentucky
Sir,

I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your obliging favour of the 12th inst. and in compliance therewith enclose the State Tax of Five Dollars and the names of the Gentlemen to whom I am permitted to refer for evidence of my fitness for the office of Commissioner of Deeds for Kentucky.
Should anything further be required, I should be glad to be advised of it.

I beg leave to refer
To. Hugh Campbell Exq. St. Louis
Governor Fred'k. Holbrook, Vermont,
Anthony J Drexel Esq. Banker. Philada as well as to all of the business firms whose names are to found on the card attached.

Pennsylvania
Comr of Deeds
Theo. M. Morgan
Philad
Com Issd Sept 29. 1862
